result.execSummary:
The defendant John L Dominick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Remain absolutely sobriety.
Participate and complete domestic abuse assessment and comply with any recommended followup counseling, if any.
No violent or abusive contact with Kelly Wilkens.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations if there are any.

Pay a fine of $50 plus costs and surcharges and pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John L Dominick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John L Dominick in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:52 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

There is a plea agreement. Defendant will enter a plea to Count 1.

Atty Sheets concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Count 1, single count.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes. There was no victim impact statements submitted to the DA's office.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 45 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period fo 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $50 plus costs and surcharges
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations if there are any
Remain absolutely sobriety
Participate and complete domestic abuse assessment and comply with any recommended followup counseling, if any
No violent or abusive contact with Kelly Wilkens

records.addlTxt: Already posted.   Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Kelly Wilkins  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

2:07 p.m. Defendant John L Dominick in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
BTC: cash bond amended with conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
